model package¶

Submodules¶

model.address module¶

class model.address.address(last, delivery, second)¶
parseLast(last)¶

Makes sure that last is parsed correctly, test cases when city has two words. EXAMPLE: SAN DIEGO CA 97201 0 1 2 3 will return a list with [“san diego”, “ca”, “97201”]

model.addressbook module¶

class model.addressbook.addressbook¶
addContact(contact)¶

Helper function to add to contacts list

addressBookImport(fileName, app)¶
export(contacts, fileName)¶

Export a line for each contact in the list “contacts” using the specified tab seperated list Last Delivery SecondRecipient Phone

findContactByName(recipient)¶

Finds all contacts by recipient which includes both the first name and last name. If more than one contact with the same recipient is found then both are added to the contactList to be returned. If no contacts are found then alert window pops up and displays contact not found

generalSearchContacts(keyword)¶

Finds all contacts that have the string keyword parameter passed in. For example all contacts can be found that contain an address with “st.” If nothing is found, then alert window pops up and displays, “No matches Found!”

load(fileName)¶

Load: sets the addressBooksList of self to the unpickled’s list.

mergeAddressBook(otherAddressBook)¶

Merges two address books together by going through the otherAddressBook and adding it’s contacts to self.contacts list

removeContact(contact)¶

Finds all contacts with the same recipient but removes the contact only with the same cid.

save(fileName, overwrite=False)¶

Save: Function for saving an addressbooks instance. The arguments are a file name, and an overwrite flag. If no flag is passed the default is to not overwrite that file if it exists.

sortByLname()¶

Sort function that sorts by lname of contacts in address book and assigns it to the self.contacts list

sortByZip()¶

Sort function that sorts by zip in address book and assigns it to the self.contacts list

model.contact module¶

class model.contact.contact(recipient)¶
addAddress(addr)¶

Adds address to addressList, before adding though makes sure that address is not already there, also checks if the zip is correct and adds to firstZip if it is the first address added to the contact (firstZip is used to sort all contacts by zip). Alert boxes pop up if the zip is not an integer or if address is already added to the contact.

addEmail(email)¶

Adds email to contact, makes sure its in lower case and not added to contact already. If email is there already an alert window will pop up giving an alert and will not add to contact

addField(name, value)¶

Allows for a user to add their own attribute to a contact with a specified value. A user could add an “age” attribute by calling contact.addField(“age”, 21). Only adds to this instance of the contact however and not every instance

addPhoneNumber(phoneNumber)¶

Adds phone number to contact checks validity must be 10 digits if not alert window appears and does not add phone number. If phone number is in contact then alert window appears and phone number is not added.

checkName(name)¶

Makes sure that if name with three words are specified with the correct first name and last name. An alert window will pop open an ask if the first name is a two word name or first word name Example: Ann Marie Smith, first name could be both Ann Marie or Ann.

checkPhone(number)¶

Makes sure that the phone number has only 10 digits. Does not support phone numbers that have 1 before area code. For example: 1 (510) 332 4565 IS NOT SUPPORTED!

checkZip(zip)¶

Makes sure that the zip is actually a digit and not some random string with chars and numbers

getField(name)¶

Helper function used for addField() function. See function for details

mailingFormat()¶

Returns string with specified mailing format...Example... john doe 1401 sw main st. san diego ca 94501 san diego 94501

removeAddress(addr)¶

Finds address and removes it from the contact’s list of addresses. If contact is not found alert window will appear and display cannot find address

removeEmail(email)¶

Finds email and removes it from the contact’s list of emails. If contact is not found alert window will appear and displays cannot find email

removePhoneNumber(phoneNumber)¶

Finds phone number and removes it from the contact’s list of phone numbers. If contact is not found alert window will appear and display cannot find phone number

setField(name, value)¶

Helper function used for addField() function. See function for details
